metadata.title: Claude Code Usage Guide | AI Coding Assistant in Terminal
metadata.description: Master Claude Code with comprehensive guides, practical tutorials, and real-world examples. Learn how to boost your development productivity with AI in the terminal.
metadata.keywords: Claude Code, AI coding, terminal, development tools, programming, artificial intelligence, coding assistant

home.title: AI Coding Assistant in Your Terminal

testGeneration.title: Test Code Generation
testGeneration.description: Automatically generates unit tests for functions and classes. Supports various testing frameworks like Jest, Pytest, and more.

documentation.title: Documentation Generation
documentation.description: Automatically generates README, API docs, and comments. Updates documentation in real-time as code changes.

debugging.title: Debugging & Error Fixing
debugging.description: Analyzes error messages and provides solutions. Reads log files and quickly identifies the root cause of bugs.

gettingStarted.subtitle: Complete installation guide from system requirements to your first project setup.

systemRequirementsDetail.windowsWarning: Claude Code does not run directly on Windows. Please use WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux).

installationDetail.nodeRequirement: Node.js 18+ required. Check with node --version and install from nodejs.org if needed.

firstProjectDetail.readyToStart: You can now start smart development with Claude Code.

commands.overview: give me an overview of this codebase
commands.authFiles: find the files that handle user authentication

commands.fixTsIgnore: suggest a few ways to fix the @ts-ignore
commands.findDeprecated: find deprecated API usage in our codebase
commands.refactorUtils: refactor utils.js to use ES2024 features

specificInstructions.title: Specific Instructions
specificInstructions.description: Instead of "fix the error", request specifically like "fix the null reference error on line 34 of user.tsx".

understandingCodebases.tip: Understand the project structure first, then explore detailed features.

startNow.title: Start Now
startNow.description: Experience Claude Code's powerful features firsthand.

tips.title: Real-World Tips
tips.subtitle: Practical tips and tricks for maximizing productivity with Claude Code in real development scenarios.
tips.mainSubtitle: Proven Claude Code techniques validated in large-scale projects
tips.detailSubtitle: Tips Validated in Real Production Environments
tips.detailDescription: We share productivity tips validated through a large-scale web app redesign project with Claude Pro MAX subscription, working 12 hours a day for a week.
tips.planningDescription: When implementing large features or changes, don't start coding immediately. Have Claude analyze existing code or documentation and create a plan in markdown files.

planningList.codebaseAnalysis: Request analysis of existing codebase structure
planningList.implementationPlan: Create step-by-step implementation plan in markdown
planningList.nuanceUnderstanding: Use alongside OpenAI o3 model to understand nuances in planning phase
planningList.structuredRoadmap: Proceed with work based on structured roadmap

tips.planningNote: Time invested in the planning phase returns 10x during implementation. The quality difference between having and not having a structured plan is stark.
tips.rulesDescription: Initially, Claude kept repeating the same mistakes, which was frustrating, but everything changed when I started managing the CLAUDE.md rules file.

rulesExampleContent.title: # Package-related Rules
rulesExampleContent.breakingChanges: - Watch for breaking changes in latest package versions
rulesExampleContent.checkDocs: - Always check official docs before coding
rulesExampleContent.noFakeSolutions: - Don't create fake solutions (mocking, temporary data)
rulesExampleContent.focusReal: - Focus only on solving real problems

tips.rulesProTipText: Use the # command to quickly add rules to your CLAUDE.md file.
tips.compactDescription: During large feature work, if Claude reaches automatic compact limits, it can lose important context and become unmanageable.
tips.compactResult: Following just these three rules greatly improves the overall experience. I was able to achieve amazing results while running Claude Code non-stop.
tips.optimizationDescription: I discovered a powerful method for continuously improving the CLAUDE.md file itself. Create a `/project:reflection` command to have Claude analyze current instructions and suggest improvements.

optimizationExamplesList.incrementalDev: Need for incremental development process guide

tips.optimizationBenefit: Each reflection cycle measurably improves the coding assistant's ability to understand project requirements.
tips.clearInstructionsText: Instead of "modify the file", request specifically like "change the useState initial value to null on line 23 of User.tsx".
tips.incrementalDevText: Don't try to implement everything at once; break it down into small units and develop incrementally.
tips.trackChangesText: Check what changes at each step, and provide immediate feedback if results differ from expectations.
tips.continuousImprovementText: Regularly run `/project:reflection` commands to analyze the CLAUDE.md file and find and apply improvements.
tips.testFirstText: Writing test cases before implementing features leads to more stable code.
tips.codeReviewText: Always review Claude-generated code and ensure it matches your project's coding style.
tips.projectContextText: Include current epics, project goals, and business context in CLAUDE.md for better decision-making.
tips.toolIntegrationText: Specify MCP connection methods and usage for tools like Jira, Slack, databases, etc.
tips.conclusion: Claude Code is a truly powerful tool
tips.conclusionText: It handles large-scale work easily and is incredibly powerful when used properly. Use these tips to experience amazing productivity yourself.

mcp.title: MCP Protocol Guide
mcp.subtitle: Learn how to extend Claude Code's capabilities with Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers.
mcp.heroSubtitle: Learn how to extend Claude Code's capabilities with Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers.

whatIsMcp.title: What is MCP?
whatIsMcp.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) is a revolutionary protocol that allows Claude Code to connect with external services and tools, dramatically expanding its capabilities beyond basic code assistance.

example.title: Example
example.description: Connect to GitHub to manage issues, Supabase for database operations, or Slack for team communication - all directly from Claude Code.

popularServers.title: Popular MCP Servers
popularServers.subtitle: Here are the most useful and popular MCP servers that can enhance your Claude Code experience:

supabase.title: Supabase MCP
supabase.description: Direct database operations, schema management, and real-time data queries.

github.title: GitHub MCP
github.description: Complete GitHub integration for repository management, issues, and pull requests.

slack.title: Slack MCP
slack.description: Team communication, channel management, and automated notifications.

examples.shareErrors: Share errors with team when they occur

postgresql.title: PostgreSQL MCP
postgresql.description: Advanced database operations, performance tuning, and data analysis.

proTip.title: Pro Tip
proTip.description: Start with GitHub and Supabase MCPs as they provide the most immediate value for development workflows.

practicalUsage.title: Ready to Get Started with MCP?
practicalUsage.description: Explore our comprehensive tutorials and guides to set up and use MCP servers effectively.
